## What is an instance variable?

Every object that is created gets its own copy of the **instance variables** that are declared in the class.

Instance variables often have a "has-a" relationship with an object. For example, a `Student`(#e7e8ea) has-a `name`(#e7e8ea). Another way to think of it is that instance variables are the nouns and adjectives that describe the characteristics of an object.

## How many instance variables can a class have?

As many as you need!

## How do values get assigned to instance variables?

Values for the instance variables are assigned in a **constructor**, which is used to set the initial state of an object. An object's state is represented in the values assigned to the instance variables.
